message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SD, cs.LG. 

This paper is about using deep reinforcement learning for interactive spoken content retrieval. The paper discusses techniques such as Deep-Q-Learning to determine the best action for the machine to take based on the present retrieval status. This work involves natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR), which are subfields of computer science that fall under the categories of cs.CL and cs.IR. Additionally, the use of deep learning techniques such as Deep-Q-Learning and the evaluation of performance metrics suggest that this paper could also fall under the categories of cs.AI, cs.SD, and cs.LG.
